column4: Installing  Ubuntu for the first time.  3 hard drives first drive is only 2.1 gig and this needs to be boot drive.  Next drive is 6.4 gig and can't be boot drive (Don't ask)  I have 3rd drive 1 gig I'm using for swap.  So is 1st drive mounted at /boot second drive mounted at / correct?
ok what do I put on second dirve?
yes there is, a base install is 1.8GB, including /var being full of crap
I ran through it and got an error.
well, try putting /var on the other disk then
just make all of the second disk /var, you can fix this up later
are you helping all these people? Thanks for taking the time to help me.  ;-)
install is continuing with 2.1 gig ext3 mounted at / and 6.4 ext3 mounted at /var.  After I finish the instal how do I fix it so /home is on 6.4 gig drive with /var?
Lot of stuff going by here.  If you can point me in the right direction I'ld appreciate it.  Just tell me what to read.  I don't see it on ubuntu's support page.
hmmm okay so I want to read how-to on what?
boot into single-user mode.  umount /var/.  mount what was /var on /mnt/.  copy contents to /var/.  come back up.  make sure it worked.  then delete the contents of /mnt/.
won't it try to remount the old var when I come back up?
yes, you have to fix /etc/fstab, too
